name: Alexander
garnish: Sprinkle fresh ground nutmeg on top.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Americano
garnish: Garnish with half orange slice and a lemon zest.
method: Mix the ingredients directly in an old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Add a splash of Soda Water. Stir gently.

name: Angel Face
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Aviation
garnish: Optional Maraschino cherry
method: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker. Shake with cracked ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Between the Sheets
method: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker. Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Boulevardier
garnish: Garnish with a orange zest, optionally a lemon zest.
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Brandy Crusta
garnish: Rub a slice of orange (or lemon) around the rim of the glass and dip it in pulverized white sugar, so that the sugar will adhere to the edge of the glass. Carefully curling place the orange/lemon peel around the inside of the glass.
method: Mix together all ingredients with ice cubes in a mixing glass and strain into prepared slim cocktail glass.

name: Casino
garnish: Garnish with a lemon zest and a maraschino cherry.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktails shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled rocks glass with ice.

name: Clover Club
garnish: Fresh raspberries.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktails shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Daiquiri
method: In a cocktail shaker add all ingredients. Stir well to dissolve the sugar. Add ice and shake. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Dry Martini
garnish: Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink, or garnish with a green olives if requested.
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass.

name: Gin Fizz
garnish: Garnish with lemon slice, optional lemon zest.
method: Shake all ingredients with ice except soda water. Pour into thin tall Tumbler glass without ice, top with a splash soda water.

name: Hanky Panky
garnish: Orange Zest.
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: John Collins
garnish: Garnish with lemon slice and maraschino cherry.
method: Pour all ingredients directly into highball filled with ice. Stir gently.
note: Use ‘Old Tom’ Gin for the Tom Collins cocktail.

name: Last Word
method: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker. Shake with ice and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Manhattan
garnish: Garnish with cocktail cherry.
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Martinez
garnish: Lemon zest.
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Mary Pickford
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Monkey Gland
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Negroni
garnish: Garnish with half orange slice.
method: Pour all ingredients directly into chilled old fashioned glass filled with ice , Stir gently.

name: Old Fashioned
garnish: Garnish with orange slice or zest, and a cocktail cherry.
method: Place sugar cube in old fashioned glass and saturate with bitter, add few dashes of plain water. Muddle until dissolved. Fill the glass with ice cubes and add whiskey. Stir gently.

name: Paradise
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Planter's Punch
garnish: Garnish with orange zest.
method: Pour all ingredients directly in a small tumbler or a typical terracotta glass.
note: Add dilution up to taste, it can be given by water, ice or fresh juices.

name: Porto Flip
garnish: Sprinkle with fresh ground nutmeg.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Ramos Fizz
method: Pour all ingredients except soda water in a cocktail shaker with ice, Shake for two minutes, double strain in a glass, pour the drink back in the shaker and hard shake without ice for one minute. Strain into a highball glass, top up with soda.
note: The drink was invented by Henry Ramos in 1888, at his bar Meyer’s Table d'Hotel Internationale in New Orleans. The Ramos Fizz was originally shaken for 12 minutes by a crew of 30 bartenders who passed the shaker from one to another.

name: Rusty Nail
garnish: Garnish with lemon zest.
method: Pour all ingredients directly into an old fashioned glass filled with ice. Stir gently.

name: Sazerac
garnish: Garnish with lemon zest.
method: Rinse a chilled old-fashioned glass with the absinthe, add crushed ice and set it aside. Stir the remaining ingredients over ice in a mixing glass . Discard the ice and any excess absinthe from the prepared glass, strain the mixed drink into the glass.
note: The original recipe changed after the American Civil War, Rye Whiskey substituted Cognac as it became hard to obtain.

name: Sidecar
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Stinger
garnish: Optional mint leave.
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass.

name: Tuxedo
garnish: Garnish with cherry and lemon zest
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass.

name: Vieux Carre
garnish: Garnish with orange zest and maraschino cherry.
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Whiskey Sour
garnish: Garnish with half orange slice and maraschino cherry, optionally use orange zest.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well. Strain into cobbler glass. If served “On the rocks”, strain ingredients into old fashioned glass filled with ice.
note: If egg white is used shake little harder to release and incorporate the foam from the egg white.

name: White Lady
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Bellini
method: Pour peach puree into the mixing glass with ice, add the Prosecco. Stir gently and pour in a chilled flute glass.

name: Black Russian
method: Pour the ingredients into the old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.
note: WHITE RUSSIAN – Float cream on the top and stir in slowly.

name: Bloody Mary
garnish: Celery, Lemon Wedge (Optional)
method: Stir gently all the ingredients in a mixing glass with ice, pour into rocks glass.
note: If requested served with ice, pour into highball glass.

name: Caiprinha
method: Place lime and sugar into a double old fashioned glass and muddle gently. Fill the glass with cracked ice and add Cachaca. Stir gently to involve ingredients.
note:
CAIPIROSKA – Instead of Cachaca use Vodka;
CAIPIRISSIMA – Instead of Cachaca use Rum.

name: Champagne Cocktail
garnish: Garnish with orange zest and maraschino cherry.
method: Place the sugar cube with 2 dashes of bitters in a large Champagne glass, add the cognac. Pour gently chilled Champagne.

name: Corpse Reviver #2
garnish: Garnish with orange zest.
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker with ice. Shake well and strain in chilled cocktail glass.

name: Cosmopolitan
garnish: Garnish with lemon twist.
method: Add all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice. Shake well and strain into large cocktail glass.

name: Cuba Libre
garnish: Garnish with lime wedge.
method: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.

name: French 75
method: Pour all the ingredients, except Champagne, into a shaker. Shake well and strain into a Champagne flute. Top up with Champagne. Stir gently.

name: French Connection
method: Pour all ingredients directly into old fashioned glass filled with ice cubes. Stir gently.

name: Golden Dream
method: Pour all ingredients into shaker filled with ice. Shake briskly for few seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Grasshopper
garnish: Optional mint leave.
method:
Pour all ingredients into shaker filled with ice.
Shake briskly for few seconds. Strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Hemingway Special
method: Pour all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake well and strain into a large cocktail glass.

name: Horse's Neck
garnish: Garnish with rind of one lemon spiral.
method:
Pour Cognac and ginger ale directly into highball glass with ice cubes. Stir gently.
If preferred, add dashes of Angostura Bitter.

name: Irish Coffee
method:
Warm black coffee is poured into a pre-heated Irish coffee glass. Whiskey and at least one teaspoon of sugar is added and stirred until dissolved. Fresh thick chilled cream is carefully poured over the back of a spoon held just above the surface of the coffee. The layer of cream will float on the coffee without mixing.
Plain sugar can be replaced with sugar syrup

name: Kir
method: Pour Crème de Cassis into glass, top up with white wine.
note: KIR ROYAL – Use Champagne instead of white wine

name: Long Island Iced Tea
garnish: Lemon Slice (Optional)
method:
Add all ingredients into highball glass filled with ice.
Stir gently.

name: Mai-Tai
garnish: Garnish with pineapple spear, mint leaves and lime peel.
method: Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice. Shake and pour into a double rocks glass or an highball glass.
note: The Martinique molasses rum used by Trader Vic was not an Agricole rum but a type of rum from molasses.

name: Margarita
garnish: Half salt rim (Optional)
method:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass

name: Mimosa
garnish: Garnish with orange twist (optional).
method: Pour orange juice into flute glass and gently pour the sparkling wine. Stir gently.

name: Mint Julep
garnish: Garnish with a mint sprig.
method: In a Julep cup, gently muddle the mint with sugar and water. Fill the glass with cracked ice, add the Bourbon and stir well until the cup frosts.

name: Mojito
garnish: Garnish with sprigs of mint and slice of lime.
method: Mix mint springs with sugar and lime juice. Add splash of soda water and fill the glass with ice. Pour the rum and top with soda water. Light stir to involve all ingredients.

name: Moscow Mule
garnish: Garnish with a lime slice
method: In an Mule Cup or rocks glass, combine the vodka and ginger beer. Add lime juice and gently stir to involve all ingredients.

name: Pina Colada
garnish: Garnish with a slice of pineapple with a cocktail cherry.
method: Blend all the ingredients with ice in a electric blender, pour into a large glass and serve with straws.
note: Historically a few drops of fresh lime juice was added to taste. 4 slices of fresh pineapple can be used instead of juice.

name: Pisco Sour
garnish: Few dashes of Amargo bitters on top as an aromatic garnish.
method:
Add all ingredients into a shaker with ice.
Shake and strain into a chilled goblet glass.

name: Sea Breeze
garnish: Garnish with an orange zest and cherry.
method: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.

name: Sex on the Beach
garnish: Garnish with half orange slice.
method: Build all ingredients in a highball glass filled with ice.

name: Singapore Sling
garnish: Garnish with pineapple and maraschino cherry
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into Hurricane glass.

name: Tequila Sunrise
garnish: Garnish with half orange slice or an orange zest
method: Pour tequila and orange juice directly into highball glass filled with ice cubes. Add the grenadine syrup to create chromatic effect (sunrise), do not stir.

name: Vesper
garnish: Garnish with lemon zest.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake and strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Zombie
garnish: Garnish with mint leaves.
method: Add all ingredients into an electric blender with 170 grams of cracked ice. With pulse bottom blend for a few seconds. Serve in a tall tumbler glass.
note: Donn’s Mix: 2 parts of fresh yellow grapefruit and 1 part of cinnamon syrup

name: Barracuda
garnish: Pineapple and Cherry, optional mint spring for additional aroma.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker except the Prosecco, shake well with ice, strain into chilled highball glass filled with ice and top up with Prosecco.

name: Bee's Knees
garnish: Optionally garnish with a lemon or orange zest.
method: Stir honey with lemon and orange juices until it dissolves, add gin and shake with ice. Strain into a chilled cocktail glass.

name: Bramble
garnish: Garnish optionally with a lemon slice and blackberries.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker except the Creme de Mure, shake well with ice, strain into chilled old fashioned glass filled with crushed ice, then pour the blackberry liqueur (Creme de Mure) over the top of the drink, in a circular motion.

name: Canchanchara
garnish: Garnish with a lime wedge.
method: Mix honey with water and lime juice and spread the mixture on the bottom and sides of the glass. Add cracked ice, and then the rum. End by energetically stirring from bottom to top.

name: Dark 'n Stormy
garnish: Garnish with a lime wedge or slice.
method: In a highball glass  filled with ice pour the ginger beer and top floating with the Rum.
note: Officially this cocktail is done with Gosling's Black Seal Rum

name: Espresso Martini
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Fernandito
method: Pour the Fernet Branca into a double old fashioned glass with ice, fill the glass up with Cola. Gently stir.

name: French Martini
garnish: Squeeze oil from lemon peel onto the drink.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Illegal
method: Pour all ingredients into the shaker. Shake vigorously with ice.  Strain into a chilled cocktail glass, or “on the rocks” in a traditional clay or terracotta mug.

name: Lemon Drop Martini
garnish: Garnish with sugar rim arround the glass.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Naked and Famous
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: New York Sour
garnish: Garnish with lemon or orange zest with cherry.
method: Pour all ingredients into the shaker. Shake vigorously with ice.  Strain into a chilled rocks glass filled with ice. Float the wine on top.

name: Old cuban
garnish: Garnish with mint springs.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker except the sparkling wine, shake well with ice, strain into chilled elegant cocktail glass. Top up with the sparkling wine.

name: Paloma
garnish: Garnish with a slice of lime.
method: Poor the tequila into a highball glass, squeeze the lime juice. Add ice and salt, fill up pink grapefruit soda. Stir gently.

name: Paper Plane
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: Penicillin
garnish: Garnish with a candied ginger.
method: Muddle fresh ginger in a shaker and add the remaining ingredients, except for the Islay single malt whiskey. Fill the shaker with ice and shake. Double-strain into a chilled old fashioned glass with ice. Float the single malt whisky on top.
note: The official notes suggest Lagavulin 16 years old whisky for the peated whisky.

name: Russian Spring Punch
garnish: Garnish with blackberries and optionally a lemon slice as well.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker except the sparkling wine, shake well with ice, strain into chilled tall tumbler glass filled with ice and top up with sparkling wine.

name: Southside
garnish: Garnish with mint springs.
method:
Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, double-strain into chilled cocktail glass.
If egg white is used shake vigorously.

name: Spicy Fifty
garnish: Garnish with a red chili pepper
method: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, double-strain into chilled cocktail glass.
note: The official notes specify the honey syrup from Monin.

name: Aperol Spritz
garnish: Garnish with a slice of orange.
method: Build all ingredients into a wine glass filled with ice. Stir gently.
note: There are other versions of the Spritz that use Campari, Cynar or Select instead of Aperol.

name: Suffering Bastard
garnish: Garnish with mint spring and optionally an orange slice as well.
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker except the ginger beer, shake well with ice, Pour unstrained into a Collins glass or in the original Suffering Bastard mug and top up with ginger beer.

name: Tipperary
garnish: Garnish with a slice of orange.
method: Pour all ingredients into mixing glass with ice cubes. Stir well. Strain into chilled martini cocktail glass.

name: Tommy's Margarita
garnish: Garnish with a lime slice.
method: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled rocks glass filled with ice.

name: Trinidad Sour
method: Pour all ingredients into cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.

name: VE.N.TO
garnish: Garnish with lemon zest and white grapes.
method: Pour all ingredients into the shaker. Shake vigorously with ice. Strain into a chilled small tumbler glass filled with ice.

name: Yellow Bird
method: Pour all ingredients into a cocktail shaker, shake well with ice, strain into chilled cocktail glass.
